Articles.Content:
I haven't found a topic like this, so I felt I have to start one.

The title explains it all:

Where do you come from?

-You could also include some pictures about main tourist attractions near your home.

For example:

I live in Budapest, Hungary, in the eastern part of Central Europe.

Some pics about the most important points of interest:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited January 20, 2014 by jmiki8

Earth.

You are here.

Philippines. Manila, to be exact.

Government corruption is more fun here.

Over there. No there! Right next to that big oak tree on the left. My driveway is right after it. There is nothing of interest around where I live except for the polar bears and I don't have any pictures of them to show. On the bright side I live within 2 miles of a nuclear strike zone so if we ever get into a nuke war I'm toast. The amusing thing is that my sister-in-law is from Japan and it is illegal for her to come to my house because of that nearby nuke target.

Edit

I just found out that one bear died a while back and the other was taken to a zoo out west so there are no more Polar bears around where I am.

Edited January 20, 2014 by dr_jt
Devon in Britain. Not much here apart from an extraordinary amount of rain.
Cool! I've visited Devon once, Barnstaple and the sorrounding villages, to be exact.
Wet West Wales!
United states, eastern Nebraska. ( practically the only habitable part )

I hail from the state in the US where the only remarkable things about it are its exceptionally, unbelievably high murder rate and that it looks like a mitten. Michigan: You're doing it wrong (Someone trademark that)

United states, eastern Nebraska. ( practically the only habitable part )

No way. There are lots of habitable ares in the US. Like where I am in Massachusetts. It's a very habitable area. A little cold and nasty right now but otherwise a pretty nice area.

I hail from the state in the US where the only remarkable things about it are its exceptionally, unbelievably high murder rate /QUOTE]

May I invite you to Baltimore, MD? DO NOT go into that city at night if you're unfamiliar with it.
Dayton Kentucky! Wooooo!

Devon in Britain. Not much here apart from an extraordinary amount of rain.

I live in devon as well! I agree with your statement about the rain XD

I live in devon as well! I agree with your statement about the rain XD

Scary thing is I may know you.... Unless you're from north Devon (they're strange up there)
Southern Finland. It's either snowing or -20C with high wind which makes it feel like -35. Or both...
https://maps.google.com/?ll=56.810488,-132.951264&spn=0.02112,0.066047&t=h&z=15

Scary thing is I may know you.... Unless you're from north Devon (they're strange up there)

Wait, WHAT! I live in south west devon, Teignbridge to be more precise.

Wait, WHAT! I live in south west devon, Teignbridge to be more precise.

South West Devon as well!!! (Though I havn't heard of Teignbridge ) I'm from Tavistock.
AMURICA. The land of hot dogs, baseball, and that polar vortex that's mucking everything up right now. And I live right on the northwest tip of Pennsylvania, so it's basically on top of us. Sigh.
houston texas. not much here execpt for the space center...

AMURICA. The land of hot dogs, baseball, and that polar vortex that's mucking everything up right now. And I live right on the northwest tip of Pennsylvania, so it's basically on top of us. Sigh.

idk about you but it feels like spring here. thanks for stealin' all our cold.
Oakville, Canada. About thirty minutes away from Rob Ford's domain.
Brisbane, Australia. Where the animals will tear yah arms off.
Mesa, Arizona. Where the heat causes your arms to fall off all by themselves.
